did.abstract: The Catholics for Choice Records are comprised of organizational records, including correspondence, reports, newspaper clippings, and articles, that document the organization's mission of "support[ing] a woman's moral and legal right to follow her conscience in matters of sexuality and reproductive health."

bioghist.p: Founded as Catholics for a Free Choice in 1973, and now known as Catholics for Choice (CFC), the organization seeks "to serve as a voice for Catholics who believe that the Catholic tradition supports a woman's moral and legal right to follow her conscience in matters of sexuality and reproductive health" ( http://catholicsforchoice.org/about/default.asp). Based in Washington, D.C., CFC also works for reproductive justice with partners in Latin American and western Europe.

scopecontent.p: The Catholic for Choice Records are comprised of correspondence, reports, newspaper clippings, and articles. The collection also includes documentation regarding the reaction to "A Catholic Statement on Pluralism and Activism," which appeared in the "New York Times" on October 7, 1984 and led to Patricia Hussey and Barbara Ferraro, two nuns among the signers, to resign from the Sisters of Notre Dame de Namur.
NOTE: The container list for this collection is available in the Sophia Smith Collection. Please contact us to request a copy.

accessrestrict.p:
The papers are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection with the following caveats:
This collection has not been fully processed and therefore may be difficult to use.

Copyright to materials created by others may be owned by those individuals or their heirs or assigns. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Catholics for Choice, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to collection are expected and may not be reflected in this record.

acqinfo.p: The Catholics for Choice Records were donated to the Sophia Smith Collection in 2015.
